text: You are not broken. You are healing.
author: Unknown

text: This pain will shape you — but it doesn't define you.
author: You

text: Grief is just love with nowhere to go.
author: Jamie Anderson

text: Radical ownership is the beginning of peace.
author: You

text: You didn't fail — you outgrew who you were pretending to be.
author: Unknown

text: Letting go is not giving up. It's choosing yourself.
author: You

text: You are still worthy of love, even if someone else couldn't give it.
author: You

text: You're not starting over — you're starting stronger.
author: Unknown

text: Every morning you get back up is a win.
author: You

text: You can't heal what you won't feel.
author: You

text: Trauma is not what happens to you, but what happens inside you as a result of what happened to you.
author: Bessel van der Kolk

text: Being able to feel safe with other people is probably the single most important aspect of mental health.
author: Bessel van der Kolk

text: You can’t get rid of fear or sadness, but you can learn to meet them with kindness.
author: Tara Brach

text: Perhaps the biggest tragedy of our lives is that freedom is possible, yet we can pass our years trapped.
author: Tara Brach

text: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: Those who have a ‘why’ to live, can bear almost any ‘how’.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: The only person you can change is yourself.
author: Robert Glover

text: The road to masculinity is paved with ownership and truth.
author: Robert Glover

text: Closure doesn’t come from your ex. It comes from building a life so full they wouldn’t recognize you now.
author: Susan J. Elliott

text: Grief is a process, not a punishment. Let it do its work so you can begin yours.
author: Susan J. Elliott

text: Being single is not a punishment — it's a powerful place to rebuild and discover who you really are.
author: John Kim

text: You are not missing your other half. You are already whole.
author: John Kim

text: A lifetime of glory is worth a moment of pain.
author: Laura Hillenbrand (Unbroken)

text: The resilience of the human spirit is forged in the fire of suffering.
author: Laura Hillenbrand (Unbroken)

text: The brokenhearted are the bravest among us — they dared to love.
author: Brené Brown

text: Owning our story and loving ourselves through that process is the bravest thing we’ll ever do.
author: Brené Brown

text: Healing is not about forgetting — it's about remembering without pain.
author: Susan J. Elliott

text: You don’t need closure from them. You need commitment to yourself.
author: Susan J. Elliott

text: The trauma response is not a sign of weakness. It’s a sign that you survived.
author: MC McDonald

text: You are not broken. You are a human being with a nervous system that has adapted to survive.
author: MC McDonald

text: We don’t need to fix ourselves. We need to understand ourselves.
author: MC McDonald

text: Healing begins when we stop asking 'What’s wrong with me?' and start asking 'What happened to me?'
author: MC McDonald
